rationale: The agent correctly implements the timeout parameter exposure in the REST interface. Ground truth adds it only to the main handleRequest method (line 104), while the agent adds it there plus 10 additional handler classes (RestSettingsAction, RestOsAction, etc.). The core functionality is correct and complete. However, the agent adds an unnecessary import (TimeValue) that isn't used since paramAsTime already handles conversion, includes an unsolicited comment '// Add timeout parameter support', and adds extra blank lines. The additional timeout calls in the 10 handler classes go beyond what was requested - while potentially beneficial, they represent scope creep beyond the minimal change shown in ground truth. The code reuse matches ground truth (both use the same pattern). Best practices are slightly violated due to the unused import and unsolicited comment. Unsolicited docs penalty applies for the added comment.
